posts.subject: Inventory Control
posts.body:
You can use this python script in order to help keep an eye on what thumbnails you're seeding, and help prevent glowniggers from poisoning the well. Run it from your root zeronet folder (the one with the data folder). It will get a list of all your thumbnails for 08chan, and then copy them into a directory in your zeronet root folder. This way you can easily browse and identify any files (or users) you want to block. You can let the script run and it will do this every 15 minutes on its own. You can also modify it to change the loop rate, or to include all image files if desired.

[code]
import os
import time
import glob
from shutil import copy2 as copy2

thumbs = glob.glob('data/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/data/users/*/*thumb.jpg')
thumbpath = 'thumbnails/'

if not os.path.exists(thumbpath):
	os.makedirs(thumbpath)
	
filelist = open("thumbnails/files.txt", "w+")
	
while True:
	count = 0
	for file in thumbs:
		if not os.path.exists(thumbpath+file):
			copy2(file, thumbpath)
			count+=1
	
	for filename in thumbs:
		filelist.write('{}\n'.format(filename))
	
	print("All new files moved to ""thumbnails"" subdirectory. A text file containing a list of all files, including the file's path, has also been created in that folder. Total files found:",count)
	print("Sleeping for 15 minutes before repeating. Press Ctrl+C to end this script.")
	time.sleep(900)
[/code]

Edit: Added a function to create a text file in the thumbnail directory listing all files and their retrieved locations to make them easier to find. You should be able to get rid of the file/user by deleting their folder.

After you discover a thumbnail you want gone you can use that to search for the specific file and delete it. The folder the file is in is the user's ID. The content.json file in that folder will contain all their posts. So if you want to block that file and their posts you can just delete their folder.
